page.title: 10THE BATTLEFIELD OF BOSWORTH
page.content: History has recorded that on 22nd August 1485, Richard III, King of England, engaged Henry Tudor, Earl of Richmond, in the final battle of the War of the Roses. It is generally held that the battle took place on a site which now constitutes part of the privately owned Ambion Hill Farm and consequently a major part of the actual battlefield has been subjected to intensive farming. In 1974 a Battlefield Centre, housing a comprehensive collection of relics, exhibits and displays, was opened at Ambion Hill and exteded in 1985 in preparation for the quincentenary celebrations. A commemorative service is held on the battlefield site each year as a memorial to the soldiers that were killed in the battle.
